name: Pallipalayam Chicken
preparation: Step 1: Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds. Let them splutter.
Step 2: Add sliced shallots and sauté until golden brown.
Step 3: Add curry leaves and dried red chilies, and fry for a minute.
Step 4: Add turmeric powder and mix well.
Step 5: Add chicken pieces and salt, and cook until the chicken is half done.
Step 6: Add grated coconut and mix well.
Step 7: Cook on low heat until the chicken is fully done and the mixture is dry.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Chettinad Kozhi Rasam
preparation: Step 1: Boil chicken pieces with turmeric and salt until tender.
Step 2: Extract tamarind juice and set aside.
Step 3: Dry roast pepper, cumin, and coriander seeds, then grind into a powder.
Step 4: In a pot, sauté garlic and curry leaves in oil.
Step 5: Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 6: Add the tamarind juice, ground spices, and chicken stock. Bring to a boil.
Step 7: Add the cooked chicken pieces and simmer for 10 minutes.
Step 8: Serve hot as a soup or with rice.

name: Thalappakatti Chicken Biryani
preparation: Step 1: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices for 1 hour.
Step 2: Cook basmati rice until 70% done and set aside.
Step 3: In a pan, sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 4: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 5: Add the marinated chicken and cook until tender.
Step 6: Layer the cooked rice over the chicken in a heavy-bottomed pot.
Step 7: Cover and cook on low heat for 20 minutes (dum cooking).
Step 8: Mix gently and serve hot with raita.

name: Madurai Kozhi Kuzhambu
preparation: Step 1: Heat gingelly oil in a pan and sauté shallots and garlic.
Step 2: Add curry leaves and fry for a minute.
Step 3: Add chicken pieces and cook until they turn white.
Step 4: Add chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Step 5: Add tamarind extract and bring to a boil.
Step 6: Simmer until the chicken is cooked and the gravy thickens.
Step 7: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice.

name: Kozhi Thengai Varuval
preparation: Step 1: Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds. Let them splutter.
Step 2: Add curry leaves and dried red chilies, and fry for a minute.
Step 3: Add turmeric powder and mix well.
Step 4: Add chicken pieces and salt, and cook until the chicken is half done.
Step 5: Add grated coconut and mix well.
Step 6: Cook on low heat until the chicken is fully done and the mixture is dry.
Step 7: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Chicken Kola Urundai
preparation: Step 1: Grind chicken into a fine paste along with garlic, ginger, and green chilies.
Step 2: Mix the paste with chopped onions, coriander leaves, and gram flour.
Step 3: Add salt and spices, and mix well to form a dough.
Step 4: Shape the dough into small balls.
Step 5: Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Step 6: Fry the balls until golden brown and crispy.
Step 7: Drain on paper towels to remove excess oil.
Step 8: Serve hot with chutney or sauce.

name: Vanjiram Kozhi Chops
preparation: Step 1: Marinate chicken with homemade masala and salt for 1 hour.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 3: Add curry leaves and fry for a minute.
Step 4: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 5: Add the marinated chicken and cook until tender.
Step 6: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 7: Cook until the gravy thickens.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Malli Kozhi Curry
preparation: Step 1: Grind coriander leaves, green chilies, and coconut into a paste.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 3: Add ginger-garlic paste and fry for a minute.
Step 4: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 5: Add the ground paste and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Step 6: Add chicken pieces and salt, and cook until tender.
Step 7: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Attu Kozhi Masala
preparation: Step 1: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 2: Add curry leaves and fry for a minute.
Step 3: Add ginger-garlic paste and fry for a minute.
Step 4: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 5: Add spices and mix well.
Step 6: Add chicken pieces and salt, and cook until tender.
Step 7: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Kadai Chicken with Milagu
preparation: Step 1: Heat oil in an iron kadai and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 2: Add curry leaves and fry for a minute.
Step 3: Add ginger-garlic paste and fry for a minute.
Step 4: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 5: Add crushed black pepper and mix well.
Step 6: Add chicken pieces and salt, and cook until tender.
Step 7: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Kari Dosa
preparation: Step 1: Cook minced mutton with onions, tomatoes, and spices until tender.
Step 2: Prepare dosa batter and spread it on a hot griddle.
Step 3: Place a portion of the cooked mutton on the dosa.
Step 4: Fold the dosa and cook until crispy.
Step 5: Flip and cook the other side.
Step 6: Remove from the griddle and cut into pieces.
Step 7: Serve hot with chutney or sambar.
Step 8: Enjoy the unique flavor of Madurai-style kari dosa.

name: Nenju Elumbu Rasam
preparation: Step 1: Boil goat bones with turmeric and salt until tender.
Step 2: Extract tamarind juice and set aside.
Step 3: Dry roast pepper and cumin, then grind into a powder.
Step 4: In a pot, sauté garlic and curry leaves in oil.
Step 5: Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 6: Add the tamarind juice, ground spices, and bone stock. Bring to a boil.
Step 7: Simmer for 10 minutes.
Step 8: Serve hot as a soup or with rice.

name: Vaniyambadi Mutton Biryani
preparation: Step 1: Marinate mutton with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices for 1 hour.
Step 2: Cook basmati rice until 70% done and set aside.
Step 3: In a pan, sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 4: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 5: Add the marinated mutton and cook until tender.
Step 6: Layer the cooked rice over the mutton in a heavy-bottomed pot.
Step 7: Cover and cook on low heat for 20 minutes (dum cooking).
Step 8: Mix gently and serve hot with raita.

name: Mutton Uppu Kari
preparation: Step 1: Heat oil in a pan and add curry leaves and red chilies.
Step 2: Add mutton pieces and salt, and cook until tender.
Step 3: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 4: Cook until the mutton is dry and well-roasted.
Step 5: Remove from heat and let it rest for 5 minutes.
Step 6: Serve hot with rice or roti.
Step 7: Enjoy the unique flavor of Kongu Nadu-style mutton uppu kari.
Step 8: Store leftovers in an airtight container for later use.

name: Eral Kari Thokku
preparation: Step 1: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 2: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 3: Add tamarind extract and bring to a boil.
Step 4: Add chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Step 5: Add mutton pieces and cook until tender.
Step 6: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 7: Cook until the gravy thickens.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Mutton Kudal Kuzhambu
preparation: Step 1: Clean mutton intestines thoroughly and boil until tender.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 3: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 4: Add tamarind extract and bring to a boil.
Step 5: Add chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Step 6: Add the boiled intestines and cook for 10 minutes.
Step 7: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice.

name: Madurai Mutton Chukka
preparation: Step 1: Heat oil in a pan and sauté shallots until golden brown.
Step 2: Add curry leaves and red chilies, and fry for a minute.
Step 3: Add spices and mix well.
Step 4: Add mutton pieces and salt, and cook until tender.
Step 5: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 6: Cook until the mutton is dry and well-roasted.
Step 7: Remove from heat and let it rest for 5 minutes.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Paaya (Mutton Trotter Soup)
preparation: Step 1: Clean mutton trotters thoroughly and boil until tender.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 3: Add ginger-garlic paste and fry for a minute.
Step 4: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 5: Add spices and mix well.
Step 6: Add the boiled trotters and cook for 10 minutes.
Step 7: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 8: Serve hot as a soup or with rice.

name: Aatu Kaal Kari Varuval
preparation: Step 1: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 2: Add curry leaves and fry for a minute.
Step 3: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 4: Add spices and mix well.
Step 5: Add goat leg pieces and salt, and cook until tender.
Step 6: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 7: Cook until the gravy thickens.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Egg Kothu Parotta
preparation: Step 1: Shred parotta into small pieces and set aside.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 3: Add curry leaves and green chilies, and fry for a minute.
Step 4: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 5: Beat eggs and pour them into the pan.
Step 6: Add the shredded parotta and mix well.
Step 7: Cook until the eggs are fully done.
Step 8: Serve hot with chutney or sauce.

name: Muttai Masala Vadai
preparation: Step 1: Boil eggs, peel, and cut them into halves.
Step 2: Mix gram flour, chopped onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, and salt to form a batter.
Step 3: Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.
Step 4: Dip the egg halves in the batter and coat evenly.
Step 5: Fry the coated eggs until golden brown and crispy.
Step 6: Drain on paper towels to remove excess oil.
Step 7: Serve hot with chutney or sauce.
Step 8: Enjoy the crispy and spicy muttai masala vadai.

name: Egg Podimas
preparation: Step 1: Boil eggs, peel, and mash them coarsely.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds. Let them splutter.
Step 3: Add curry leaves and green chilies, and fry for a minute.
Step 4: Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Step 5: Add the mashed eggs and salt, and mix well.
Step 6: Cook for 2-3 minutes until everything is well combined.
Step 7: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Sura Puttu Muttai Varuval
preparation: Step 1: Cook shark meat until tender and shred it into small pieces.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 3: Add curry leaves and green chilies, and fry for a minute.
Step 4: Add the shredded shark meat and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Step 5: Beat eggs and pour them into the pan.
Step 6: Mix well and cook until the eggs are fully done.
Step 7: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Egg Kuzhi Paniyaram
preparation: Step 1: Mix rice flour, chopped onions, green chilies, curry leaves, and salt to form a batter.
Step 2: Heat a kuzhi paniyaram pan and add a few drops of oil in each mold.
Step 3: Pour a spoonful of batter into each mold.
Step 4: Crack an egg into each mold on top of the batter.
Step 5: Cover and cook on low heat until the bottom is golden brown.
Step 6: Flip and cook the other side until done.
Step 7: Remove from the pan and serve hot with chutney or sauce.
Step 8: Enjoy the unique egg kuzhi paniyaram.

name: Nattu Muttai Kuzhambu
preparation: Step 1: Heat gingelly oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 2: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 3: Add tamarind extract and bring to a boil.
Step 4: Add chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Step 5: Add boiled country eggs and cook for 10 minutes.
Step 6: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 7: Cook until the gravy thickens.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice.

name: Egg Roast with Milagu
preparation: Step 1: Boil eggs, peel, and make small slits on the surface.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 3: Add curry leaves and fry for a minute.
Step 4: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 5: Add crushed black pepper and grated coconut. Mix well.
Step 6: Add the boiled eggs and cook for 5 minutes.
Step 7: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Kalakki
preparation: Step 1: Beat eggs with salt and set aside.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds. Let them splutter.
Step 3: Add curry leaves and green chilies, and fry for a minute.
Step 4: Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Step 5: Pour the beaten eggs into the pan.
Step 6: Cook on low heat until the eggs are fluffy and runny.
Step 7: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Muttai Muringakai Thokku
preparation: Step 1: Boil eggs, peel, and set aside.
Step 2: Cook drumstick pieces until tender.
Step 3: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 4: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 5: Add tamarind extract and bring to a boil.
Step 6: Add chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Step 7: Add the boiled eggs and drumstick pieces, and cook for 10 minutes.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice.

name: Meen Varuval with Karuveppilai
preparation: Step 1: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt for 10 minutes.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds. Let them splutter.
Step 3: Add curry leaves and red chilies, and fry for a minute.
Step 4: Add the marinated fish and cook until golden brown on both sides.
Step 5: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 6: Remove from heat and let it rest for 5 minutes.
Step 7: Serve hot with rice or roti.
Step 8: Enjoy the crispy fish fry with curry leaf flavor.

name: Nandu Rasam
preparation: Step 1: Boil crab pieces with turmeric and salt until tender.
Step 2: Extract tamarind juice and set aside.
Step 3: Dry roast pepper and cumin, then grind into a powder.
Step 4: In a pot, sauté garlic and curry leaves in oil.
Step 5: Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 6: Add the tamarind juice, ground spices, and crab stock. Bring to a boil.
Step 7: Simmer for 10 minutes.
Step 8: Serve hot as a soup or with rice.

name: Chemmeen Moilee
preparation: Step 1: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 2: Add curry leaves and green chilies, and fry for a minute.
Step 3: Add prawns and cook until they turn pink.
Step 4: Add coconut milk and bring to a boil.
Step 5: Simmer for 5-7 minutes until the gravy thickens.
Step 6: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 7: Serve hot with rice or appam.
Step 8: Enjoy the creamy and flavorful chemmeen moilee.

name: Viral Meen Puttu
preparation: Step 1: Clean and mash catfish into a paste.
Step 2: Mix turmeric, chili powder, and salt into the paste.
Step 3: Heat oil in a pan and add curry leaves.
Step 4: Add the fish paste and cook until it forms a thick mixture.
Step 5: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 6: Remove from heat and let it cool.
Step 7: Shape the mixture into small balls or patties.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice or as a side dish.

name: Nandu Thokku
preparation: Step 1: Boil crab pieces until tender and set aside.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 3: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 4: Add tamarind extract and bring to a boil.
Step 5: Add chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Step 6: Add the boiled crab pieces and cook for 10 minutes.
Step 7: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Squid Pepper Fry
preparation: Step 1: Clean squid thoroughly and cut into rings.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 3: Add curry leaves and green chilies, and fry for a minute.
Step 4: Add crushed black pepper and mix well.
Step 5: Add squid pieces and salt, and cook until tender.
Step 6: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 7: Cook until the squid is well-coated with the masala.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice or as a side dish.

name: Sankara Meen Vattichathu
preparation: Step 1: Clean red snapper and make small slits on the surface.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 3: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 4: Add tamarind extract and bring to a boil.
Step 5: Add chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Step 6: Add the fish and cook for 10 minutes.
Step 7: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice.

name: Kola Meen Kuzhambu
preparation: Step 1: Clean catfish and set aside.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 3: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 4: Add tamarind extract and bring to a boil.
Step 5: Add chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Step 6: Add coconut milk and bring to a boil.
Step 7: Add the fish and cook for 10 minutes.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice.

name: Eral Sodhi
preparation: Step 1: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 2: Add curry leaves and green chilies, and fry for a minute.
Step 3: Add prawns and cook until they turn pink.
Step 4: Add coconut milk and bring to a boil.
Step 5: Simmer for 5-7 minutes until the gravy thickens.
Step 6: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 7: Serve hot with rice or appam.
Step 8: Enjoy the creamy and flavorful eral sodhi.

name: Meen Karuvaadu Thokku
preparation: Step 1: Soak dry fish in water for 10 minutes to remove excess salt.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 3: Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Step 4: Add tamarind extract and bring to a boil.
Step 5: Add chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Step 6: Add the soaked dry fish and cook for 10 minutes.
Step 7: Adjust seasoning if needed.
Step 8: Serve hot with rice.
